author: Cassie Smith
title: Things to do Wednesday, Oct. 14
text:
Things to do Wednesday, Oct. 14 12:00 a.m. Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 | Filed in: Entertainment 
“Evita” at Zach Theatre 
7:30 p.m. Wednesday. Through Nov. 1. $25-$80. 1510 Toomey Road. 512-476-0541, zachtheatre.org. 
Experience passion and seduction in the seven-time Tony Award-winning musical “Evita,” Zach’s newest production. Revered by her people as an advocate for the poor, Eva Perón climbed meteorically from the slums of Argentina to her role as beloved first lady at the age of 27, becoming one of the most powerful women in the world. The musical tells her unforgettable true story through some of theater’s most beautiful songs, including “Don’t Cry for Me Argentina.” — Ari Auber “Friends With,” from the exhibit “Words: Kevin McNamee-Tweed.” 
S.C. Gwynne at BookPeople 
7 p.m. Wednesday. 603 N. Lamar Blvd. 512-472-5050, www.bookpeople.com. 
Journalist S.C. Gwynne puts his vivid storytelling skills to use in his book, “ Rebel Yell ,” which chronicles the life of Stonewall Jackson, an eccentric physics professor who became a Confederate general. Author of the award-winning New York Times bestseller, “Empire of the Summer Moon, ” Gwynne’s work has been published in Texas Monthly, New York Times, Harper’s and the Los Angeles Times. “Rebel Yell,” by S.C. Gwynne. 
“Words: Kevin McNamee-Tweed” at Pump Project 
12 to 5 p.m. Wednesdays. Through Oct. 31. 702 Shady Lane. www.pumpproject.org. 
“Words” is a series of drawings that explores language in visual terms. Drawn and painted with Sumi ink on Tan Rives BFK paper, the collection is united stylistically, although the techniques used and subject matter of each one vary widely. The collection as a whole, done by the gallery curator at Big Medium, embraces ambivalent and multiplicitous meanings and seeks to expose, mythologize or reanimate words. —A.A. Madeline Trumble stars in Zach Theatre’s production of “Evita.”
